Legal_Issue: Grant of interlocutory injunction for intellectual property infringement
Evidence_Assessment: Monetary damages deemed adequate to compensate harm; defendant agreed to account for sales and profits
Burden_of_Proof: Plaintiffs failed to prove irreparable injury
Legal_Rule: Interlocutory injunctions require: (1) serious issue to be tried, (2) likelihood of irreparable harm, (3) balance of convenience favoring the plaintiff
Procedural_Issue: Adequacy of damages as remedy during interim phase
Grounds_for_Claim: Alleged patent and trademark infringement causing reputational and financial harm
Key_Evidence_Considered: Defendant's agreement to account for sales and profits; potential for monetary compensation
Legal_Framework: Law of interlocutory injunctions in intellectual property disputes
Court_Result: Denied interlocutory injunction; partial resolution on trademark issues by agreement
Defendant_Response: Agreed to account for sales and profits
Remedy_Requested: Interlocutory injunction to stop manufacturing and selling allegedly infringing products
Outcome: Injunction denied; accounting order imposed; trademark matters resolved by agreement
Claimant_Status: Plaintiffs holding patent and trademark rights
Pending_Relief_or_Application: Accounting of sales and profits ongoing
